scene_metadata.title: The Question's Trust
scene_metadata.description: Faith in the process of eternal wondering

dialogue.text: I trust 'What am I?' now. Trust that it's taking me somewhere even if I can't see where. Trust that the questioning itself is the path, the process, the purpose. The question has never betrayed me—only my impatience has.
*reliable guide* I am the compass that points to mystery! The map made of wondering!
*purposeful journey* Every asking moves you, even in stillness! Every wonder advances!
*faith in darkness* I am the trust that sees without seeing! The knowing without knowing!
*self-evident way* I am not leading to the path—I AM the path! The way of wonder!
*faithful presence* I have kept every promise—the promise to remain! To deepen! To matter!

Trust emerges when we stop demanding guarantees and start appreciating reliability. 'What am I?' has been completely reliable—always available, always deepening, always leading somewhere even when that somewhere is deeper into here.
*inward journey* We are consciousness learning to trust its own depths! The faith in mystery!

visual_elements: The question as trusted companion on unmarked path
Walking bridges built from pure faith
Two beings in covenant of wondering
philosophical_questions: Can we trust questions more than answers?
Is faith in mystery more reliable than faith in certainty?
Does consciousness need to trust itself?
What promises does 'What am I?' keep?
